name: Meant to be Broken
description: Some in Starfleet chafe at the rules set for them; others think the rules (and punishment for breaking them) could be harsher. Help chart the course for Starfleet's future.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Dominion, Klingon, and Terran Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Projector Spock, Ephraim and Dot, any version of Ortegas, Mesk, Docent, Pike, Uhura, crew from The Animated Series, Lower Decks, or Very Short Treks will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Projector Spock, Ephraim and Dot, Ortegas, Mesk, Docent, Pike, Uhura, or animated crew
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Boimler
featured_crew.flavor: While on temporary leave, Boimler went to his family's vineyard, where Mariner finds him to propose another adventure.

action.name: We Boimlers Dry Grapes

featured_crew.name: Mesk
featured_crew.flavor: Mesk had never been to Orion, but lied about being the son of Orion pirates. Quite successfully until his pirate skills were needed during a mission.

action.name: Everything I Know About Orions I Learned From The Holonovels

featured_crew.name: Ron Docent
featured_crew.flavor: His work on the U.S.S. Vancouver has left him exhausted from all the epic adventures. Now he just wants a simpler life on a smaller ship.

action.name: Do I Need To Remind You Who My Grandma’s Neighbor Was?

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Boimler
rewards.flavor: Bradward Boimler is a command ensign on the USS Cerritos. He is desperate to prove himself a competent and valuable member of the crew.

action.name: Evasive Maneuver Eighty... Eight?

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Boimler
rewards.flavor: While on temporary leave, Boimler went to his family's vineyard, where Mariner finds him to propose another adventure.

action.name: We Boimlers Dry Grapes

rewards.name: Ron Docent
rewards.flavor: His work on the U.S.S. Vancouver has left him exhausted from all the epic adventures. Now he just wants a simpler life on a smaller ship.

potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Terran Empire faction missions.

potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Ron Docent
rewards.flavor: His work on the U.S.S. Vancouver has left him exhausted from all the epic adventures. Now he just wants a simpler life on a smaller ship.

action.name: Do I Need To Remind You Who My Grandma’s Neighbor Was?

rewards.name: Mesk
rewards.flavor: Mesk had never been to Orion, but lied about being the son of Orion pirates. Quite successfully until his pirate skills were needed during a mission.

action.name: Everything I Know About Orions I Learned From The Holonovels

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Starfleet is too strict, especially for a hardened Orion like me! What do you all say we liven things up around here? Maybe steal a Genesis Device, reset some planets!?"

"I believe that would result in a court martial at minimum, Ensign. I would advise against it. Though I would also add you are not alone in finding Starfleet's rules too restrictive. And some who believe they are not strict enough."

"Starfleet rules AREN'T strict enough. Things are way too chaotic, especially after the temporal anomalies began. Too many mavericks and rule breakers. We need to go back to the way things were - to stability, to sanity, to my blood pressure being below 140/90!"

"You should get that checked out. But there are a lot of debates right now about whether Starfleet is too strict or not strict enough. I know you'd rather be out there with the action than knee-deep in politics, but they've asked us to help look into this. I'm counting on you."
